channel.title: Compile error: illegal start of expression. Anyone got a clue?
channel.description:
Well... I try adding this to my CLIENT in Client.Java...
[code]private class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 aClass30_sub2_sub1_sub1Array1219[/code]
Then i try to compile but i get an error saying that it's an illegal start for an expression. I was following Galkons tutorial on how to add custom crowns... I'm a beginner coder so i would like to know what to do so that i can fix this next time.

item.title: Compile error: illegal start of expression. Anyone got a clue?

item.title: Compile error: illegal start of expression. Anyone got a clue?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:5, topic:300135”][quote author=Mercifies link=topic=396419.msg2944394#msg2944394 date=1252121849]
It was an illeagle start of an expression meaning ~~ it needs a bracket.
[/quote]
You sir, know nothing about about clients or server, well java imparticular. If there is a missing bracket it throws 100 errors when compiling.[/quote]

Harshness. Mercifies is very helpful! But then, so am I, and likewise towards you.

@Topic: Post all compiler/batch related problems in the sticky… Search… And other blah… Pretty sure it was answered, maybe not.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error: illegal start of expression. Anyone got a clue?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Mercifies:

It was an illeagle start of an expression meaning ~~ it needs a bracket.

You sir, know nothing about about clients or server, well java imparticular. If there is a missing bracket it throws 100 errors when compiling.

@TOPIC, this could be a couple reasons tbh. but if you dont have what is below exactly, with the []'s and such, then dont bother. But replace that line with this and see if it works

private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[];

Read full topic

@PushedPrawn wrote:

All i did was change it. at the beginning before i changed it there were no brackets at all. There’s not brackets on ANY of the other similar codes (which there’s about 20-30 above and below it)
